node.title: Samuel L. Jackson loves his job
node.description: The Oscar-nominated actor who has appeared in more than 150 films talks about his love of popcorn movies, the business of Hollywood, and his new TV miniseries, "The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey."

node.title: Lessons from the 1918 Spanish Flu epidemic
node.description: The influenza pandemic that killed 675,000 Americans a century ago is often referred to as the "forgotten flu." Also forgotten: lessons it might have taught us for how to deal with the cost, in lives, of COVID-19.

node.title: How far will Putin go – and how far will America go to stop him?
node.description: No one can possibly know for sure what Russia's leader, who has launched an invasion of neighboring Ukraine, may do next. But how might Americans be forced to sacrifice in hopes of saving Ukraine's fragile young democracy?

node.title: Blinken: NATO members have "green light" to send fighter jets to Ukraine
node.description: "Winning a battle is not the same thing as winning a war. Taking the city is not the same thing as capturing the hearts and minds of Ukrainians," Blinken said.

node.title: Ukrainian civilians race to evacuate under 11-hour cease-fire
node.description: Authorities prepared Sunday for a second attempt to evacuate civilians​ from a southern city pounded by a week-long Russian attack.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 15,161 new community cases, 618 in hospital, one death
node.description: There are 15,161 new community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today, with 610 people now in hospital, the Ministry of Health reports.

node.title: Trump renews NATO criticism after Russia's invasion of Ukraine
node.description: The former president spoke to top GOP donors Saturday night.

node.title: Climate change, Covid-19 loom over Alaska's 50th annual sled dog race
node.description: Forty-nine mushers and their teams of huskies trotted through Alaska's largest city on Saturday to start the 50th annual running of the Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race, an event transformed by climate…

node.title: Christ Church Cathedral restoration still on track for completion in 2027
node.description: Progress is steady for the Christ Church Cathedral restoration, but locals cannot expect to see a finished building any time soon.

node.title: Name of victim in Hamilton homicide investigation released
node.description: Police have opened a homicide investigation after a man died at a house in Huntington last night.

node.title: Death toll in Australian flooding hits 17
node.description: Sydney braced for more rain on Sunday after being drenched by heavy downpours over the past week, as the death toll from flooding across the eastern part of the country reached 17.

node.title: Siege of Mariupol: Thousands trapped as Russia ignores ceasefire
node.description: Russian forces continued to shell the Ukrainian city of Mariupol on Saturday, despite agreeing to a ceasefire just hours earlier - throwing an attempted mass evacuation of civilians into chaos.

node.title: Russia announces limited ceasefire in Ukraine for civilian evacuations
node.description: Russia said its forces had stopped firing near two Ukrainian cities to allow safe passage to civilians fleeing fighting, but was continuing its broad offensive.

node.title: Prosecutor: College student's murder serves as a cautionary tale
node.description: Shot at least nine times, texts found on a University of Mississippi student's Apple Watch proved invaluable to investigators searching for her killer and provided insight about what may have led to her murder

node.title: Ukraine can beat Russia - US Secretary of State
node.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has told the BBC that he is convinced Ukraine can win its war with Russia.

node.title: 'We can't keep up': Papakura Marae struggles with Covid demand
node.description: Auckland's Papakura Marae says it is struggling to cope with the sheer number of whānau needing its services.

node.title: Homicide investigation after Taupō motel death
node.description: Police were called to the Adelphi Motel in Taupō this morning after a report of a man injured.

node.title: 'Eternal boy': The many cricket lives of Shane Warne
node.description: As Australia plans a state funeral after the legend's shock death, the ABC's Russell Jackson remembers what made "Warnie" so unforgettable. Audio

node.title: Nato rejects Ukraine no-fly zone, EU readies more Russia sanctions
node.description: "We are not part of this conflict," Nato Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said denying Ukraine's request for help to protect its skies from Russian warplanes.

node.title: Rore reveals surprise pregnancy
node.description: Former Silver Ferns captain Katrina Rore, who was signed in a bid to boost the hopes of the Waikato Bay of Plenty Magic, has announced a surprise pregnancy.

node.title: Super Rugby was a slogfest this weekend
node.description: Opinion - Finally, after a long wait, all New Zealand-based Super Rugby teams were in action over the weekend. The problem was they all combined to completely stink up the joint in three forgettable… Video

node.title: 'Slow this down' - Too soon to say Omicron has peaked, says epidemiologist
node.description: People shouldn't read too much into today's decline in Covid-19 case numbers, epidemiologist Professor Rod Jackson says.

node.title: Tourism NZ says industry will focus on reopening 'rehiring and hiring new staff'
node.description: The head of Tourism New Zealand says 2022 looks like the year of reopening, but he acknowledges it will be a bumpy road ahead.

node.title: Ukraine athletes call for peace after medal haul on day one of Winter Games
node.description: Ukraine won seven medals including three golds to move to the top of the medal table on the first day of the Beijing Winter Paralympics.

node.title: Heavy rain warning issued for Fiordland
node.description: Between 80 to 100 millimetres of rain is expected to fall between this afternoon and tomorrow morning.

node.title: Patsy Cline's "Dream Home"
node.description: The legendary country music superstar's home outside Nashville, recently on the market, has been restored to its mid-century look. "Sunday Morning" digital producer Roman Feeser took a tour.

node.title: Record-breaking heat, tornadoes and hail predicated across the U.S. this weekend
node.description: Tornadoes, thunderstorms, large hail and record-breaking warm temperatures are possible across the country.

node.title: Liverpool's Mane secures jittery win over West Ham
node.description: Liverpool eked out a 1-0 victory over West Ham United to narrow the the gap to Premier League leaders Manchester City.

node.title: International sailors await boat reunions after border rules relax
node.description: Marina managers hope border restrictions being eased will bring hundreds of private yachts back from overseas.

node.title: Homicide investigation underway after death in Hamilton
node.description: A man died at a house in Huntington last night.
